org.team5940.robot_core.modules.functional.controls

Class GenericControlsModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team5940.robot_core.modules.SimpleModule
      • org.team5940.robot_core.modules.functional.controls.GenericControlsModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlsModule, Module, TestableModule

    public class GenericControlsModule
extends SimpleModule
implements ControlsModule, TestableModule
    Implementation of ControlsModule for any number of GenericHIDs, buttons, and axes.

      • addAxis

        public GenericControlsModule addAxis(java.lang.String axisName,
                                     GenericHID device,
                                     int rawAxis,
                                     boolean isInverted)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds an axis to this or replaces the existing one. Returns this for chaining.
        Parameters:
        axisName - The name of the axis you are adding. Identifier used in getAxis(String)
        device - The GenericHID device to read from.
        rawAxis - The raw axis number to be read from device.
        isInverted - A boolean value for if the axis is inverted.
        Returns:
        this. Allows chaining of adds directly after initialization. (e.g. new GenericControlsModule(...).addAxis(...).addAxis(...).addButton(...)...;)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any inputs are null.

      • getButton

        public boolean getButton(java.lang.String button)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: ControlsModule
        Gets current value of joystick button based on the type of joystick you are using.
        Specified by:
        getButton in interface ControlsModule
        Parameters:
        button - String representation of the button (ex. "jump").
        Returns:
        current position of the button as a boolean.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If buttonAvailable() would return false.

      • addButton

        public GenericControlsModule addButton(java.lang.String buttonName,
                                       GenericHID device,
                                       int rawButton,
                                       boolean isInverted)
        Adds a button to this or replaces an existing one. Returns this for chaining.
        Parameters:
        buttonName - The name of the button you are adding. Identifier used in getButton(String)
        device - The GenericHID device to read from.
        rawButton - The raw axis number to be read from device.
        isInverted - Boolean for is inverted buttons.
        Returns:
        this. Allows chaining of adds directly after initialization. (e.g. new GenericControlsModule(...).addAxis(...).addAxis(...).addButton(...)...;)
